meanings.definition: A mythical bird that is said to live for several hundred years before burning itself to death on a pyre and rising from the ashes with renewed youth to live through another cycle.
meanings.sent1: Legends tell of the phenix's incredible ability to rise from its own ashes.
meanings.sent2: The phenix's story of rebirth captivates the imagination of many.
meanings.sent3: Kids at the school play pretended to be a phenix, pretending to rise from the ground dramatically.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like that of a phenix, always finding a way to start anew.
meanings.sent5: The image of the phenix emerging from the flames symbolizes resilience and hope.

meanings.definition: A person or thing regarded as uniquely remarkable in some respect.
meanings.sent1: In the small town, Mrs. Johnson was considered the phenix of the community.
meanings.sent2: The old library was a phenix, standing out with its unique architecture.
meanings.sent3: At the party, John was the phenix of the dance floor, showing off his impressive moves.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity in solving problems made her a phenix among her peers.
meanings.sent5: The phenix of the team, he always came up with innovative ideas to lead them to success.
